text: (calm music)
- My name is Rob Melka.
I'm a Partner Solutions Architect Manager.
I've been at AWS for five years now.
And prior to joining the Partner Network,

I worked with the Cloud
Support Engineering team
where I supported AWS customers
with their Enterprise issues.
About three years into the role

I wanted to get closer to
where things are built.

And at Amazon you have various
opportunities to do that.

So I did some digging
and wanted to investigate
what my future role looked like.
So I spoke with managers
and looked at what my career looked like

and I wanted to get closer to
supporting partners at scale

since I can impact our
AWS customers as well.
This is more of a proactive approach

than a reactive approach
with support engineering.

So in our team, we work with
partners on a scalable approach
where we have partner engagements
where we're helping them validate

their technology solutions to
ensure that they're following
AWS best practices.

My favorite leadership principle
is learn and be curious

because here at Amazon, you
are constantly learning.

There's a lot to learn
and you can just basically
run with it and build the next big thing.
